sen.j: 伊藤 仁斎（いとう じんさい、寛永4年7月20日 (旧暦)（1627年8月30日） - 宝永2年3月12日 (旧暦)（1705年4月5日））は、江戸時代の前期に活躍した儒学者・思想家。
sen.e: Jinsai ITO (August 30, 1627 - April 5, 1705) was a Confucian scholar and philosopher in the early Edo period.
Jinsai ITO (August 30, 1627 - April 5, 1705) was a Confucian scholar and philosopher in the early Edo period.
Jinsai ITO (August 30, 1627 - April 5, 1705) was a Confucian scholar and philosopher in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 京都の生まれ。
sen.e: He was born in Kyoto.
He was born in Kyoto.
He was born in Kyoto.

sen.j: 日常生活のなかからあるべき道徳と人間像を探求して提示した。
sen.e: He searched for the idea of an ideal moral person in daily life and advocated it.
He searched for the correct path and the ideal form of man in daily life, and advocated it.
He searched for the correct path and the ideal form of man in daily life, and advocated it.

sen.j: 諱は、はじめ維貞、のち維禎。
sen.e: His imina (personal name that was generally used posthumously or by one's parents or lord) was Koresada, firstly written as 維貞 but later 維禎.
sen.cmt: 「維貞・維禎」→両方とも「これさだ」。漢字の違いなので、漢字を混ぜて訳しました。
sen.e: His imina (personal name that was generally used posthumously or by one's parents or lord) was Koresada, firstly written as 維貞 but later 維禎 (both names are pronounced the same, but are written in diferent kanji).
sen.cmt: 説明を訳してたしました。
sen.e: His imina (personal name that was generally used posthumously or by one's parents or lord) was Koresada, firstly written as 維貞 but later 維禎 (both names are pronounced the same, but are written in diferent kanji).

sen.j: 仮名 (通称)は、源吉、源佐、源七。
sen.e: He common names were Genkichi, Genza and Genshichi.
He common names were Genkichi, Genza and Genshichi.
He common names were Genkichi, Genza and Genshichi.

sen.j: 屋号は、鶴屋七右衛門。
sen.e: His trade name was Shichiemon TSURUYA.
His trade name was Shichiemon TSURUYA.
His trade name was Shichiemon TSURUYA.

sen.j: 仁斎は号であり、諡号は古学先生。
sen.e: Jinsai was his pseudonym, and his posthumous title was Kogaku Sensei (Master of Ancient Learning).
Jinsai was his pseudonym, and his posthumous title was Kogaku Sensei (Master of Ancient Learning).
Jinsai was his pseudonym, and his posthumous title was Kogaku Sensei (Master of Ancient Learning).

sen.j: 寛永4年7月20日（1627年8月30日） 京都で誕生。
sen.e: He was born in Kyoto on August 30, 1627.
He was born in Kyoto on August 30, 1627.
He was born in Kyoto on August 30, 1627.

sen.j: 1662年 京都の堀川に古義堂を開く。
sen.e: In 1662, he established Kogido (School of Ancient Meaning) in Horikawa, Kyoto.
In 1662, he established Kogido (School of Ancient Meaning) in Horikawa, Kyoto.
In 1662, he established Kogido (School of Ancient Meaning) in Horikawa, Kyoto.

sen.j: 宝永2年3月12日（1705年4月5日） 死没。
sen.e: He died on April 5, 1705.
He died on April 5, 1705.
He died on April 5, 1705.

sen.j: 主著として、『論語古義』『孟子古義』『語孟字義』『中庸発揮』『童子問』『古学先生文集』などが挙げられる。
sen.e: His major books include "Rongo Kogi" (Ancient Meanings of the Analects), "Moshi Kogi" (Ancient Meanings of the Mencius), "Gomo Jigi" (Philosophical Lexicography of the Analects and Mencius), "Chuyo Hakki" (Commentary on the Doctrine of the Mean), "Dojimon" (Elementary Philosophical Dialogues) and "Kogaku Sensei Bunshu" (Collected Prose Works of the Master of Ancient Learning), but he devoted himself in lecturing, organizing and elaborating his works and thus did not publish any book during his lifetime.

His major works include "Rongo Kogi" (Ancient Meanings of the Analects), "Moshi Kogi" (Ancient Meanings of the Mencius), "Gomo Jigi" (Philosophical Lexicography of the Analects and Mencius), "Chuyo Hakki" (Commentary on the Doctrine of the Mean), "Dojimon" (Elementary Philosophical Dialogues) and "Kogaku Sensei Bunshu" (Collected Prose Works of the Master of Ancient Learning). However, he devoted himself to lecturing, organizing, and elaborating on his works, and thus did not officially publish any books during his lifetime.
sen.cmt: book を books に直しました。公刊を "officially publish" と分かりやすく訳しました。文章が長すぎるので分割。
sen.e: His major works include "Rongo Kogi" (Ancient Meanings of the Analects), "Moshi Kogi" (Ancient Meanings of the Mencius), "Gomo Jigi" (Philosophical Lexicography of the Analects and Mencius), "Chuyo Hakki" (Commentary on the Doctrine of the Mean), "Dojimon" (Elementary Philosophical Dialogues) and "Kogaku Sensei Bunshu" (Collected Prose Works of the Master of Ancient Learning).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: しかし生前は講義と著述の整理・推敲に尽力し、著作を公刊することはなかった。
sen.e: However, he devoted himself to lecturing, organizing, and elaborating on his works, and thus did not officially publish any books during his lifetime.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 古義学を提唱。
sen.e: He advocated Kogigaku (Study of Ancient Meaning).
He advocated Kogigaku (Study of Ancient Meaning).
He advocated Kogigaku (Study of Ancient Meaning).

sen.j: 仁斎の学問手法は、当時支配的だった朱子学的経典解釈を廃し、直接テクストを検討するというものである。
sen.e: Jinsai's method of study was to investigate the text directly, by abolishing Neo-Confucian interpretation of scriptures that was dominant at that time.
Jinsai's method of study was to investigate the text directly, by abolishing Neo-Confucian interpretation of scriptures that was dominant at that time.
Jinsai's method of study was to investigate the text directly, by abolishing Neo-Confucian interpretation of scriptures that was dominant at that time.

sen.j: 朱子学は学問体系としては非常に整ってはいたが、その成立過程に流入した禅学や老荘思想といった非儒教的な思想のために経書の解釈において偏りがあった。
sen.e: Neo-Confucianism was a very systematic study, but had a biased interpretation of scriptures because of the influence of non-Confucian philosophy it had received in the process of its establishment, such as the Zen study and philosophy of Lao-tse and Chuang-tse.

Neo-Confucianism was a very systematic study, but had a biased interpretation of scriptures because of the influence of non-Confucian philosophy it had received in the process of its establishment, such as the Zen study and philosophy of Lao-tse and Chuang-tse.

Neo-Confucianism was a very systematic study, but had a biased interpretation of scriptures because of the influence of non-Confucian philosophy it had received in the process of its establishment, such as the Zen study and philosophy of Lao-tse and Chuang-tse.

sen.j: 仁斎はそのような要素を儒学にとって不純なものとみなし、いわば実証主義的な方法を用いた。
sen.e: Jinsai regarded such factors as impurities for Confucianism and employed a rather positivist approach.
Jinsai regarded such factors as impurities for Confucianism and employed a rather positivist approach.
Jinsai regarded such factors as impurities for Confucianism and employed a rather positivist approach.

sen.j: このような傾向は同時代の儒学研究に共通にみられるものである。
sen.e: Such trend was common in Confucian studies of that time.
Such trend was common in Confucian studies of that time.
Such trend was common in Confucian studies of that time.

sen.j: 『論語古義』（関儀一郎編『日本名家四書注釈全書』論語部壱、東洋図書、1922年4月）
sen.e: "Rongo Kogi" (Part I of the Rongo volumes of "Nihon Meika Shisho Chushaku Zensho" [The Complete Commentaries of Japanese Great Scholars on the Four Books of Confucianism] edited by Giichiro SEKI, published by Toyo Tosho in April 1922)

sen.j: 『孟子古義』（関儀一郎編『日本名家四書注釈全書』孟子部壱、東洋図書、1924年10月）

sen.j: 木村英一編集・解説 『伊藤仁斎集 日本の思想11』（筑摩書房）1970年
sen.e: "Ito Jinsai Shu Nihon no Shiso 11" (Collected Works of Jinsai ITO - Japanese Philosophy, Volume 11) edited and commented by Eiichi KIMURA, published by Chikuma Shobo in 1970

sen.cmt: 厳明→中国人名で姓が厳 (Yang)、名が明 (Ming)です。"Ming YANG"としました。
